name: Push-Ups
how_to_perform:
1. Start in a prone position on the floor. Position your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Keep your feet together and your body in a straight line from head to heels. This is your starting position.

2. Engage your core and keep your body straight. Avoid letting your hips sag or rise too much.

3. Lower your body towards the ground by bending your elbows. Keep your elbows at about a 45-degree angle from your body. Lower yourself until your chest is just above the floor.

4. Push through your palms to straighten your arms and lift your body back to the starting position. Keep your core tight and your body in a straight line.

5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, ensuring proper form throughout each repetition.
short_summary: Push-ups are a bodyweight exercise that involves lowering and raising your body while keeping a plank position, engaging the chest, triceps, and shoulders.
